findings.message: Reduced-motion guidance is internally contradictory: it says `.pi-gone-section` is "NOT suppressed," then states the fade animation should be suppressed; this conflicts with the later hardening rule at line 164 (`animation: none`) and can lead to incorrect implementation.

Global acceptance says the removed section "fades after 6 seconds," but reduced-motion requirements specify no fade and JS-only removal; acceptance criteria should explicitly scope fade behavior to non-reduced-motion mode.

"localStorage pattern already established … with try/catch guard" is only partially true in current HTML (theme-init read is guarded, nav theme-toggle write is unguarded), so wording should remain precise to avoid implying both operations are already guarded.

note: Round 3 is the final round per critique-loop-protocol.md. Score 8/10 → lp_score 4.0 ≥ 4.0 → credible. No Critical findings. Remaining findings are advisory for lp-do-build.
